cons: Night shift rn's are sometimes expected to have 7 patients per 1 nurse which is way too much for the acuity of the patients.

pros: Short commute; ok pay; community resource

pros: - Pay commensurate with experience - Flexible work schedule - Shoes and uniforms provided - Good benefits package - Annual market-competitive pay adjustments/increases - Reinstated merit pay as of 2023

pros: Run from here, don't walk! I have nothing positive to say. After years, upon reflection, I'd say 80% of my time there was a huge waste of my own resources and mental health. cons: Morale! Morals! Deceptive! Inept! No Diversity! Cons!

review_title: It’s a job and has its pros and cons
pros:
Many people genuinely care about the quality of their work and take
pride in caring for patients. 

While the WMC campus could use some enhancements to make it more useful, it is a very pretty facility, especially the landscaping and grounds.
cons:
Low low pay!!!! for the industry, market and region!! Don’t care what benchmarking and studies you do… It’s still just way too low across the board… (except the actual Board is paid WELL for their time, but that is seriously on the backs and at the expense of all of the employees… Easily 5 alternatives that would pay more in reasonable commuting distance.

Plagued by lack of cohesion. Feels like a ship without a rudder sometimes, where some departments are pitted against each other for seemingly no good reason. 

The lack of talent/staff that VH is able to effectively retain and successfully onboard is a direct reflection on the leaders at the highest level of the company.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Luray, VA

pros: Great environment with a new CEO that is very motivated to advance the system and focuses on improvement. As the sole healthcare provider in the area, I've never worked somewhere so integrated into the community. It's pretty rewarding.
cons: Intense workload in some areas, poor IT for now, but the system is heavily investing in improvement.

pros: Working with hands, getting to know the procedures of the lab, slight work flexibility based from the supervisor.

review_title: There's better options, just not close to Winchester.

Also, there are no paid holidays. They use your PTO to cover holidays for every position.

pros: Flexible hours. Good benefits and good managers. Sensitive to employee needs
cons: Orientation process wasn’t very thorough about non-clinical things

pros: benefits, compensation, large community presence
cons: lack of quality leadership, lacks value of employee loyalty

pros: My section is at least flexible on start and end times, that is about the only real pro that I can think of for working for this horrible place.
cons:
There are so very many. They are a hospital and yet they have some of the worst health insurance, so they can save more money for the higher ups I suppose.
They give a "whooping" 2% discount to employees that use their services, while other hospital systems in the surrounding area treat their employees for free.
They do NOT pay for holidays. They expect you to use your vacation/sick time to pay for it yourself.
They do NOT care about your home life, nor your stress. You are given more than one job to complete within your 40 hours and if you go even 1 minute over that time you get reprimanded, and yet if you don't get that work done you also get reprimanded.
If you have missed the allotted 2 days in 6 months that you're allowed for sick time, and something happens such as an accident that even puts you in the hospital, expect them to have written you up when you get out of the hospital. This actually happened to a coworker of mine.

pros: Beautiful facility with lots of growth.  They have expanded their ED, opened a Cancer Center and have a huge growth slated for 2019.  High patient volume and in house training will provide you with lots of experience for excellent caring.
cons:
When I started with them the organization seemed great. Very interested in its employees, competitive pay, good benefits, everything that you would want from a career. Over several years, many senior leaders have left and things have gone down hill. Thee is no concern for employees now, you're simply a number. The pay has diminished while the work load more than doubled. The benefits package has turned to welfare with high deductibles and copays. As a manager, I was forced to take a harsh view of employees while being treated like I was on the front line.
The bottom line is this organization is solely interested in the dollar with little concern for their patients and none for their employees.

pros: There are some top quality coworkers.
cons: Low pay for the area and job. The worst benefits. PTO is below others in the area. There is no room to grow. They require a degree in within the IT department, while others in this area do not.

review_title: A fairly decent experience working there where with reasonable treatment of employees.
pros: They have a good reputation locally within the community for providing good health care mostly attributable to the physicians and nurses rather than management. This good reputation suggests they will continue on for a while and the atmosphere is pretty decent in the organization. Facilities generally are clean and well maintained.
cons: For a "not-for-profit" the company appears overly concerned about money making and squeezing profit out of everything. They are alos heavy on management perks especially as one ascends higher (I think their salaries at the very top were so high at one time that their not for profit status became at risk.

review_title: Housekeeping. Horrible. Poor management. Rude employees.
pros: Good pay. Thats about it.
cons: I worked as a housekeeper. The pay was the only thing about this job i was pleased about. Working here did nothing but make me very unhappy. Every employee in that department is unhappy and talks horrible about the company. The managers are extremely rude and do NOT deserve the position they hold. They treat their employees as slaves. They work you to death and do NOT care at all about your well being. Majority of the nurses are very rude. The majority of CNA'S play around. Nobody has respect for the housekeepers. They work themselves to death to be treated like crap. I would NEVER recommend this job to anybody. I cannot speak on the other departments behalf but i will speak on housekeeping and it is by far the worse job i have ever had. For a company that has expanded and to have clients coming from all around you think they would live up to their name and be a little more professional. That place is HELL! DO NOT WORK HERE!

review_title: I had a very positive experience at Valley Health (Warren Memorial Hospital) and felt I was well treated.
job_title: Radiology Department Secretary in Front Royal, VA
pros: I was paid well for a secretarial position.  APL/PTO was generous.  Insurance was decent.  Supervisors, dept. managers, all the way up to the president of the hospital were approachable and were always doing little things for you in an attempt to make you feel appreciated.
cons: Sick leave left a little to be desired.  Your first day or two came was built into your APL or something and then it kicked over to your official Sick Leave, or something.  It was complicated.  Luckily, I seldom missed a day.

pros:
Excellent experience with some talented staff! Advancing education and personal growth was always encouraged and supported. 
Some middle managers are very supportive.
cons: Upper management can’t see what the real problems are, due to middle management communication issues. The organization pays for a consulting firm to evaluate the current staff load, etc. and the organization decided to ignore the recommendation of additional staff.

review_title: Largest employer in the area - but high turnover
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Bunker Hill, WV
pros: For the most part your co-workers are great! I worked in 2 departments and love my co-workers in both. Also, they were pretty good about flexible hours.
cons: VERY low pay. The turnover is high because once people get experience at WMC, they move on to Loudoun, Fairfax, or another Northern Virginia hospital that pays twice as much. They just do NOT value their employees at Valley Health. Raises are a joke, usually 15 cents a year. Middle management there is a joke as well. Most of them aren't qualified. The upper administration focuses too much on cutting costs instead of employee retention and quality patient care.

pros:
Large local employer
Opportunities to advance within the company
cons:
Large employer - sometimes overlooked and only considered a number.
Annual salary increase is not truly based upon merit but rather what is budgeted.
This employer is behind the times and needs to institute more work-life flexibility.

review_title: The most vindictive place I have ever worked!
pros: co-workers who actually care about the patient
cons: too many patient safety issues. Large turn around for employees because of poor management. Very punitive with lack of raises. Short staffed and over worked employess who are just burned out. VH takes on more and more projects/patients with out adding the staff to perform the workload. Middle management on up to CEO needs an entire overhaul. Mark Merrill needs to get in touch with the real world. Employees are not just a  bunch of whiners there are some serious issues going on in that system that need to be fixed. Maybe that will happen if INOVA takes over!!

pros: Regional health system with a very caring, thoughtful executive leadership team. There are many opportunities for growth throughout the system as a PT and quality patient care is the focus.
cons: Some of our hospitals are located in more rural, small communities, which can be frustrating for younger single individuals. I'd recommend looking at locating yourself in the Winchester or Front Royal areas and consider a 1/2 hour-45 min commute if you're going to take a job in the smaller critical access hospitals.

pros: Great people in the trenches, opportunity to serve the people of your community. When a department is well run it’s a joy to work with others.
cons: Mid to upper management is untrustworthy and scheming. No sense of loyalty to long standing and hard working professionals.  No worries about morale when they want to make a change.  Really disappointing.

pros: There is reasonably good team work among co-workers despite managerial ineptitude.
cons:
1. The newest ICU managerial and Director staff are not truly intouch with reality and the mayhem they are creating.  
2. Newly created unit has become the primadonna unit and created stiff divisions among staff

review_title: factory.....clique of leaders and no movement upward unless you fit in the clique
pros: decent pay and benefits....still less than east of the mountains but for the area ok.
cons: no upward mobility, no plan for strongest employees,  people stagnate and are kept on hold....talent management is a tab on the website only...doesn't really happen

pros: I have found no pros to this place. Only endless cons.
cons: Too many managers and not enough employees to do the work needed. Upper management doesn't care about employees at all. Review system for raises is rigged so you get nothing.

review_title: Excellent benefits, above average salary for Winchester, VA
pros: I thoroughly loved working at Winchester Medical Center. Management is interested in staff professional and self development. Peers and coworkers are friendly and easy to work with. Very team oriented.
cons:
Fast paced can become extremely hectic at times.  
Can be overwhelming with too many bosses.

pros: This is a great place to start your nursing career. It is a small Medical/Surgical Unit where you get experience with a variety of patient conditions. There is also opportunity to float to Critical Care and the Emergency Department so you can get a different perspective on patient care.
cons: SMH is in a small community with people who grew up in the area. It takes some time to figure out the unique culture!

pros: They have wonderful caring employees
cons: Employees are just a number and can easily be replaced. VH expects the work of 3 out of 1 person and if it's a salary position, plan on working 14 hour days with no comp time off or additional pay.

pros: All work done eventually benefits the health of our customers.  Benefits are adequate.  I have a great commute. As one of the largest employers in the area, there are a number of benefits and discounts.  As a large local hospital everyone I meet understands my job right away.
cons: Promotions are given to less qualified staff with political ties.

pros: Great team to work with. Constant teamwork and comradeship.
cons: Horrible middle-upper management. Zero management skills from middle management. Management too involved in personal affairs/matters. Management gets too upset when ideas didn't come from them, or the employee got all the praise without any mention to management.

job_title: Nutrition Services Aide in Front Royal, VA
pros:
"Friendly Staff" if you don't ask for any help. Which is alright I suppose. 

Scheduling works well around school.
cons:
Pay isn't the best for what you do. 

Always understaffed. Management is a bit lacking.

pros:
good working environment and patient population is very nice. nice staff.
I enjoy my job a lot and meeting people in this area.
cons: don't really have any cons. i guess the benefits aren't the best and the insurance plans are not very good for the employees

job_title: Physician Practice Manager in Winchester, VA
pros: Benefits are amazing. Not hard work.
cons: One of the worst companies I have ever worked with.  Physicians rule the whole operation and I was bullied out in less than a year. Tried to implement change and improvements but was told to stop. Not a good working environment for professionals with extensive knowledge of the industry. Mostly looking for bodies to fill spots. Good place for those who only want a job without actually implementing positive change or creating revenue enhancing departments.

pros: Great coworkers and equipment to work with
cons: I loved my coworkers, but the direct management were bullies. When HR was contacted repeatedly by numerous employees, nothing changed!

pros: I cannot think of one good thing other than the co-workers I had and good relationships I developed along the way. We all stood together
cons: This place has gotten too big for its britches! They have capped out a lot of good employees for raises, and do not care about good help.

review_title: If you just want a paycheck and don't want to take pride in your work, this is the place for you.
job_title: Patient Accounts Clerk Insurance Biller in Winchester, VA
pros: No commute to northern Virginia. Largest employer in the area. Not much micro-managing. Tuition assistance available through the benefit package.
cons: Management turned horrible. Coworkers bickering. High stress volume not from the job, but from the people. Insurance very difficult to deal with. No true open door policy with management. Horrible morale. No one takes pride in their work. No access to anyone knowledgeable. HR misrepresents policies. Majority of demographic is older, white women only and not accepting of outsiders. Huge Con was having to listen to homophobic and racist talk among my coworkers while sitting at their desks, trying to do my job, and prevent my caller from hearing it. Having no voice, after office was restructured, management shifted and there is only one supervisor that is even knowledgeable about anything. However, if you speak to anyone but your own, you get in trouble and spoken to in a horrible way. There is definitely favoritism.

pros: There’s not a lot to really say other than , PTO , Decent Insurance. Some of the staff that you work with is friendly. Also willing to help cover shifts when needed.
cons: Working weekends and holidays , not a lot of overtime, sometimes things were not up to joint commission standards. Rude departments. A lot of miscommunication.

review_title: Started with hopes and dreams, but couldn't make a difference.
pros: Working for a hospital helps the community
cons: Political back stabbing and no room for growth or promotion. As the largest employer in the area your either in or out on the street. Don't complain about your workload or middle management will find a way to replace you from the lines of people waiting to take your job.

job_title: Patient Access in Front Royal, VA
pros: A plaintree facility. Treating the patient and their family.
cons: No teamwork and if you do try to help coworkers out you get reprimanded. Our supervisor is very insecure with no management experience or education past high school. She is intimidated by employees that have an education and is constantly micromanaging their every move.

review_title: Work hard with no advancement or incentives
pros: I got paid on time.
cons: The management is terrible, the incentives have been reduced to near zero while the upper echelon lines it's pocket.  The organization continues to expand while paying the most meager salaries.  The  raises have all but stopped while the company spends millions of dollars to build even more hospitals and structures.  Plus if you manage to make somebody mad, they will run you out the door one way or another.

pros: Up and coming organization.  Employees are very nice.  Wage is evaluated yearly to compete with the salary average.  Discounts on certain places
cons: Challenging work environment. They are not very organized, a lot of computer modern tech with all the old paperwork you have to do as well. a lot to take in quickly

pros: Good size hospital. Excellent bariatric program. Had a great clinical manager. Good team work on my floor. Not sure of anything else.
cons: First of all, new nurses only get paid 23/hr. I am a bachelor prepared nurse, with student loans from a university, getting paid the same as an ADN. My unit is always short staffed.

pros: Strong unit managers, team work encouraged on the floor.
cons: Pay is not competitive with surrounding areas. Nurse patient ratios too high.

pros: Employee discounts , insurance is good if you use a Valley Health physician or facility
cons: Have to use PTO days to be paid for holidays if your department is closed and you cannot come in to work

job_title: Life Enrichment Director in Billings, MT

pros: Senior execs (if you can get access to the VP's) are supportive.

review_title: Management more important than rest of staff
pros: Coworkers were amazing hard workers

pros:
